column4: I just installed ubuntu 6.01 on my laptop and I can't figure out how to get it to automatically upgrade to the newest version...I did it on my desktop pc but I can't remember how - could someone help me out?
tonyarusso.. lol u know what i mean
configure your /etc/apt/sources.list (or copy it from the desktop), then 'sudo apt-get update ; sudo apt-get dist-upgrade'

I've tried Network Manager before, it works but it doesn't show me each WiFi spots Signal Strength correctly, it shows them all at 100% strength. It also won't let me connect to my own secured/password WiFi, yet it will connect to my neighbors that isnt secured
I don't know, I haven't had this type of difficulty. But then my environment is simpler.
have you ever heard of someone not being able to see the 'true' strength before. mine are all showing up as 100% wifi stength
there is just one AP I want to connect to, unencrypted. I don't get interference from the neighbours' networks
the wrong signal strength indicator is a driver problem, I believe
Yeah, I'm using the ndiswrapper thing
have you found the docs in file:///usr/share/doc/network-manager ?
what version of Network Manager do you use
the one in dapper. Sorry, I'm not working on the machine in question right now.
